messages.content: Dear Resident, I'm honoured to be your Labour Parliamentary Candidate for Nottingham East. Born and bred in Nottingham, growing up in a single-parent household under austerity, I understand the daily injustices that we face. Under a Tory government, we've seen rents rise, wages stagnate, and our schools and hospitals reach breaking point. And as a local hate crime worker, I know that our communities need to be healed and empowered by a better project. It's time for real change. For me, politics was never about prestige and personal ambition. For too long, we've been ignored by Westminster. As your MP, I will be accessible and accountable to you; I will continue living in Nottingham, hold frequent surgeries, and take only the average UK full-time wage of £35,000 – donating the rest to local causes.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will end cuts and privatisation to provide accessible, high quality services for everyone. With a £26bn NHS rescue plan, we will recruit thousands of staff, rebuild our vital health services and completely transform social care by providing free personal care for older people and free childcare for 2-4 year olds.

Labour's National Education Service will provide free education for everyone throughout their lives, promoting all types of skills and knowledge. We will invest in every school and college, scrap tuition fees, and fund youth services so that every person, regardless of their background, has the opportunity to thrive.

The Tories created the housing crisis, with rents skyrocketing and homelessness increasing by 165%. Labour will end it: we will build 100,000 council homes per year, introduce rent controls and secure tenancies, and clamp down on rip-off landlords.

issues.education: Labour's National Education Service will provide free education for everyone throughout their lives, promoting all types of skills and knowledge. We will invest in every school and college, scrap tuition fees, and fund youth services so that every person, regardless of their background, has the opportunity to thrive.

With a £26bn NHS rescue plan, we will recruit thousands of staff, rebuild our vital health services and completely transform social care by providing free personal care for older people and free childcare for 2-4 year olds.

community.content: The Tories created the housing crisis, with rents skyrocketing and homelessness increasing by 165%. Labour will end it: we will build 100,000 council homes per year, introduce rent controls and secure tenancies, and clamp down on rip-off landlords.

images.caption: I joined our Shadow Housing Secretary at Victoria Centre Flats, where residents say the Tories' inaction is forcing Nottingham's City Homes to stop offering families from our city homes with new funding.

Local GP Dr. Irfan Malik tells me that currently only 52% of NHS staff feel they have enough time to deliver safe care to patients. Labour's NHS Rescue plan will soon end private cuts including 80,000 more health and social care workers, thousands of nurses and doctors.
I visited SFiCE Foundation in St Ann's, who run a social care for isolated people, including Esol lessons, clothes bank, food bank and hot meal.
Nottingham Law Centre staff deal daily with people facing destitution because their benefits can be delayed for weeks. Only Labour will bring back legal aid and protect hundreds of community lawyers.
I spoke with the RCCG church in the Arboretum about tackling knife crime and Labour's plans to investigate it.
Tory school cuts mean that every schoolchild in Nottingham East will see an approved cut in the money they get. Labour will attract and enjoy the children that they deserve.
